author: itsfcl
content: oh yeah they aren't compression methods

author: itsfcl
content: though the gain is probably not that big, considering the main bulk of the message is uncompressible (address, r, s)

author: itsfcl
content: my test with fse ended up making the tx *bigger*

author: itsfcl
content: though i probably implemented it wrong one way or another, so i'm asking it here

author: itsfcl
content: though entropy coders/dictionary coders to an extent will be very good for bytecode compression, as they contain a lot of repetitive data

author: finbob
content:
I noticed 2 validators missing their first post GrayGlacier proposal despite hitting all attestations with 0 inclusion distance.
Is _not upgrading EL to GrayGlacier_ an explanation for that?
From reading the `eth1_data` part of the annotated spec I'm not sure if an EL on a wrong fork (pre GrayGlacier) would lead to this behaviour?
First instance: https://beaconcha.in/validator/273524#blocks
Second instance: https://beaconcha.in/validator/397425#blocks

author: djrtwo
content: yes, if they did not upgrade their "eth1 endpoint", then they would begin to fail to propose due to not being able to include the requisite deposits

author: djrtwo
content: whereas, they can still follow and fully validate th beacon chain and thus attest

author: finbob
content: Makes sense. Interesting to see that the vast majority of stakers seem to have upgraded fine, but those two haven't. Staking pools none the less.

author: knoshua
content:
These are the slots in question: 
https://beaconcha.in/block/4147297
https://beaconcha.in/block/4147694
The blocks right after do not appear to include any deposits, so these missed proposals might be just that and unrelated to the fork
